pullRequest.body:
Show that localization at minimal primes results in rings with only a single prime ideal, implying that every non-unit element is nilpotent.

Co-authored-by: Junyan Xu <junyanxumath@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:



Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body: It wouldn't take much effort to show that the prime spectrum of these rings is a single point but I'm not sure where this would fit exactly

> It wouldn't take much effort to show that the prime spectrum of these rings is a single point but I'm not sure where this would fit exactly

I agree that this should be added, probably in `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.PrimeSpectrum.Basic` (where, for instances, there are results like [PrimeSpectrum.t1Space_iff_isField](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/PrimeSpectrum/Basic.html#PrimeSpectrum.t1Space_iff_isField) )

> I agree that this should be added, probably in `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.PrimeSpectrum.Basic` (where, for instances, there are results like [PrimeSpectrum.t1Space_iff_isField](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/PrimeSpectrum/Basic.html#PrimeSpectrum.t1Space_iff_isField) )

Done. I think the `Unique`ness result should be enough for the moment

[Here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/uniwuni/localization_min_ideals...jyxu/localization_minimalPrime?expand=1) is a slight refactor that introduces IsLocalization.AtPrime.orderIsoOfPrime and IsLocalization.AtPrime.prime_unique_of_minimal. Feel free to merge if it looks good.
Apart from @alreadydone 's comment, the whole PR now LGTM.

> [Here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/uniwuni/localization_min_ideals...jyxu/localization_minimalPrime?expand=1) is a slight refactor that introduces IsLocalization.AtPrime.orderIsoOfPrime and IsLocalization.AtPrime.prime_unique_of_minimal. Feel free to merge if it looks good.

If you add docs to the `def` to make it compile, I'll do so, sure!
I've now added a docstring, but this is something you could have done :)
LGTM

Thanks ðŸŽ‰

Why keeping these variables outside the section and the following ones inside it?
Add one line here?

```suggestion
```
I think this whole file should go inside `Localization.AtPrime` which is still quite small.
Not possible due to import cycles, sadly. I could put it in Ideal.MinimalPrime but I don't think that fits at all

I have looked at `ideal.MinimalPrime` and I think it would indeed fit there: there are results concerning localization (which are precisely the ones causing this import clash) and yours would be part of those.

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  exact âŸ¨(Â· (LocalRing.maximalIdeal _) (Ideal.IsMaximal.isPrime' _)), fun _ J _ =>
    by simpa [prime_unique hMin J]âŸ©
```

```suggestion
  simpa only [â† LocalRing.mem_maximalIdeal] using AtMinimalPrime.nilpotent_iff_mem_maximal hMin
```
thanks, been searching for a way to avoid this rw/exact antipattern for ages, somehow I always missed simpa

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Localization): add facts about localization at minimal prime ideals
